title.narrative: PM, Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers (HACT) AND RBM

description.narrative: By end 2021, UNICEF staff and partners use the appropriate tools, strategies and resources for effective programme planning, monitoring and implementation, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Economic And Social Policy General, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end 2021, the country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards to achieve the best results for children in Chad.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, UNICEF staff and partners use the appropriate tools, strategies and resources for effective programme planning, monitoring and implementation

description.narrative: As part of the implementation of the HACT assurance plan, UNICEF conducted 13 micro-evaluations in 2019. The various recommendations from the micro-evaluations relate to strengthening the capacities of implementing partners. With a view to further strengthening monitoring and implementation of the Country Programme, emphasis was placed on the training of staff and implementing partners in HACT and GAR, resulting in 34 per cent of UNICEF staff trained in GAR and HACT in 2019, along with 63 per cent and 28 percent of partners trained in HACT and GAR, respectively. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/02/2020
